Reviews.Title: Another solid camera from Dlink
Reviews.Author: Lon J. Seidman "lon@ lon.tv"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo265C5XE4Y7LFVcurrentClick) { return cv_mo265C5XE4Y7LFVcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 9:44 MinsI purchased this camera because I was quite pleased with a PTZ non-weather proof camera from Dlink and wanted something I could put outside. Just like the other camera, this is a very solid release with a ton of software and hardware features. It survived out on my front covered porch through the absolute worst part of our New England winter, weathering a snow storm and sub zero temperatures without incident. The camera continually recorded and was available via WiFi both locally on my network and through the Internet.This camera has built-in DVR capabilities with an SD Card slot which is secured by two screws to ensure the area stays weather-tight. You can interface with the card via the camera's web server and also stream it to a compatible DLNA device like a SmartTV (a bit problematic as not all TVs will support the video format) and the free video player called VLC. You can also configure the camera to FTP the video events to an external server or email them to an address you specify. Motion zones can be configured to focus motion events on specific areas. It can also record events based on sounds it hears.It records at 1280x720 at a seamless 30 frames per second. There's practically no motion blur especially in daylight. The night vision mode also works well but the reach of its infrared beam is limited.My only gripe, and why I'm rating this 4 and not 5 stars, is that the web interface is becoming increasingly difficult to operate due to its reliance on Java. Mac users will have an especially difficult time configuring it - especially the motion zones. One workaround is to purchase a 99 cent iPad app but it would be better to have HTML5 functionality that works on the web configuration screen.
